title: Use juliet's default timeout and timeout bubbling to make missed ACKs fatal.
body:
Addition to #4269.

* Makes the timeout configurable (from hardcoded 30 seconds).
* Every request has its timeout set through `juliet` means (default timeout), instead of requiring special node logic.
* In the same vein, timeouts bubble up to be a server error as well as a per-request one if configured to do so.

title: Merge 1.5.3 into dev
body: Merges all 1.5.3 changes into dev branch.

title: Revert types change and bump versions
body:
This PR includes the following changes:
* reverts the version bump of `casper-types` to 4.0.0 and contains a minor refactor to avoid the need for a breaking change to the casper-types API
* fixes clippy and audit warnings
* replaces usage of several Parity crates with our own forks containing bugfixes
* bumps version of EE and test support crates

title: Bump types to 4.0.0 for 1.5.3 compatibility in cargo release.
body:
Please consider the following when creating a PR:

* Provide a useful description of this PR, suitably verbose, aimed at helping reviewers and contributors
* Update all relevant changelogs
* Provide a link to the GitHub issue relating to this PR
* Identify if any downstream impact as in to, SDKs, SmartContracts etc

title: mechanism to increase gas cost for each message emitted within one execution
body:
Implement a mechanism to increase gas cost for each message emitted within one execution.
Also fix a few test issues and add more tests for contract level messages.

title: Fix config files for private chain tests
body:
This PR updates the test config files for the NCTL private chain tests. It also removes the stray test files that had been unused.

Closes #4303

title: Replace ping/pong feature with juliet timeouts
body:
Closes #4269.

Removes the entire ping/pong connection health feature, relying on `juliet`'s built-in timeouts instead.

title: Wait for era `1` to assume genesis, not era `2`
body:
This PR modifies the NCTL framework to wait for era 1 to assume the network reached genesis.

Previously we used 2 to be on the safe side while debugging tests that been failing due to 1.5 changes.

This should speedup the total execution time of NCTL tests.

title: Highway analysis tool
body:
This adds a draft of a tool for analyzing the consensus state. The tool prints faulty validators, validators with the most skipped rounds, and validators with lowest average max quorum (max quorum being a value calculated per round, per validator, depending on how quickly the validator participates in the round, which multiplies the reward earned by that validator).

Closes #4325

title: Merge SSE event streams
body:
This PR changes the SSE server in a way that all events are emitted through a single endpoint `<IP:Port>/events`.

Closes #4314

title: Merge feat 2.0
body:
Merge the feature branch with rewarded signatures with 2.0
To make that possible, the block header is now versioned.

title: Disable stored session and rework standard payment
body:
CHANGELOG:

- Expand the `Key` enum to have three new variants `Key::AddressableEntity` , `Key::Package` and `Key::ByteCode`
- Extend action thresholds to have an extra action for allowing upgrades
- Disable the execution of stored session
- Reworked standard payment to invoke the mint directly 
- Refactored variable names to account for the changes made by introducing the `AddressableEntity` struct


Closes #4277 #4279 #4167 and #4318

title: ee: add support for emitting contract level messages
body:
Draft work for adding Contract level messages.
Added:
* 2 new FFIs that enable contracts to manage message topics and emit human readable string messages.
* topic names and hashes are added to the addressable entity for easy discovery
* for each topic there is a control record in global state under `Key::message_topic(entity_addr, topic_hash)` that stores the count of messages that were emitted  on a topic and the block time of the block where the deploys that emitted the messages have executed.
* each message checksum is stored in global state under `Key::message(entity_addr, topic_hash, message_index)` and can be discretely queried and verified.
* messages get sent out the SSE as part of `ExecutionResultV2` for each deploy.

Some tests are currently broken because the gas costs were not adjusted in the tests.
Will address these tests in a separate PR that will also implement linear gas cost increase for messages.

title: Bump `warp` to `0.3.6`
body:
Bump `warp` to `0.3.6` in order to patch the vulnerability in `tungstenite` ([rustsec](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2023-0065)).

It has been fixed in warp in this PR: https://github.com/seanmonstar/warp/pull/1067

title: Short-circuit initialization of block and deploy metadata DB
body:
Make both `initialize_block_metadata_db()` and `initialize_deploy_metadata_db()` a no-op if there is no data to be purged on storage initialization.

Additionally, in case purging happens, hash of the purged blocks will be logged, like so:
```
2023-10-04T10:12:48.855232Z DEBUG init{; node_id=tls:7ebd..32a6}: [casper_node::components::storage storage.rs:3005] purged metadata for block 032b..0011
2023-10-04T10:12:48.855243Z DEBUG init{; node_id=tls:7ebd..32a6}: [casper_node::components::storage storage.rs:3005] purged metadata for block 2d5c..5602
```

title: Refactor usage of the ContractHash and Key types in preparation for Uref work
body:
We've identified some places in the code that were using the `Key` type where it was statically known that the key would always be a `ContractHash` which made it annoyingly difficult to prototype changes for the upcoming Uref work. This PR substitutes the types in several places. This change also made us realise that there was some unreachable code in the project, particularly in `RuntimeContext::remove_key` and `Account::extract_access_rights`. The dead code was removed.

Related to: https://app.zenhub.com/workspaces/engineering-l1-60953fafb1945f0011a3592d/issues/gh/casper-network/roadmap/143

title: GH-4108: Better error message for multi value proposal
body:
This PR changes error message for a Wasm file that was compiled with multi_value extension as we're currently supporting MVP opcodes (minus floating points). This is a follow up for PR #4082.

Error before change:

```
Enable the multi_value feature to deserialize more than one function result"
```

After the change:

```
Multi value extension is not supported
```

title: casper-types: add a new `Key` variant for contract level messages
body:
Add a new `Key::MessageTopic` variant under which message digests will be written to global state for messages emitted by contracts.

Fixes: https://github.com/casper-network/roadmap/issues/216

title: Use a standard regex in Makefile instead of a GNU specific one
body: This new regex does not use a GNU extension and also works on MacOS

title: Merge dev to 2.0
body: Merge `dev` into `feat-2.0`

title: Add further logging to BlockValidator
body:
This PR adds additional debug-level logging to the `BlockValidator`.

Closes #4298.

title: Add event queue insight to log when there are many events in the queue
body:
When the scheduler queue grows too much, the node will dump a basic breakdown of queue content into the log, like so:
```
Current event queue size (26) is above the threshold (25): details [("FinalitySignature", 3), ("FromStorage", 1), ("NetworkIncoming", 21), ("Regular", 1)]
```

The threshold is read from the environment variable: `CL_EVENT_QUEUE_DUMP_THRESHOLD`. If this variable is not set, this function is disabled.

Additionally, in order to prevent log flooding, the next dump will happen only if there are 10% more events in the queue than at the time of creating the previous dump.

This is a performance debug mechanism to support fixing issues with 16s blocks.

title: Speed up message sending by spawning fewer tasks
body: Greatly reduces the number of tasks spawned by attempting to send every message directly at least once. This should be the most common case for 99% of all messages if not under heavy load.

title: Add timeouts to `juliet` crate
body:
Closes #4139.

Adds support for timeouts to the `juliet` crate. Note that this function is not yet used in the node (`with_timeout` is never called), so there is no direct impact yet.

It also renames one function (hence the node change), adds a lot more traceability and some additional tests, fixing some bugs in the process.

title: Fix query_balance to handle addressable_entity
body:
CHANGELOG:

- Fixed the `query_balance` RPC method to handle the introduction of `AddressableEntity`

Manually verified by spinning up an NCTL network and running the casper-client against the 2.0 network


Closes #4284

title: Correctly handle multiframe message cancellation
body: Closes #4246.

title: Extend juliet unit test suite
body:
Closes #4242.

Extends the unit test coverage (though I'd prefer to add more still) covering low level functions, adding a mock-reader for IO data. Lead to at least one bug being fixed.

title: Replace `gov96` nctl test
body:
This PR replaces the nctl `gov96` test with a new `main_reactor` integration test.

The test asserts that after all but one node is killed, the network can continue once the dead nodes are restarted.

I also took the opportunity to slightly refactor the reactor test framework in order to hopefully make it a little more ergonomic and require less boilerplate in the actual tests.  This is in anticipation of other nctl tests being replaced by tests using this framework.  As a side-effect, the total time for the main_reactor tests has reduced from ~13 mins to ~4 mins, despite adding a new test case.

Closes #4151.

title: Cleanup `Option<Arc<AtomicBool>>` in `network`.
body: A small fix that replaces an uncommon edge cases with a default (the key being absent), which in both cases evaluates to `false`, this version results in simpler code though.

title: Fix issues in storage
body:
This PR fixes two separate issues:
* a historical synced block with no deploys would have no entry written for it in the `transfers_db`, causing the JSON-RPC `chain_get_block_transfers` to report the block's transfers as `null` rather than `[]`
* for a block with a non-zero number of successful transfers, if its execution results were put to storage more than once, the initial valid entry in the `transfers_db` would be overwritten with an invalid empty collection, causing the JSON-RPC `chain_get_block_transfers` to report the block's transfers as `[]` rather then the correct value

Th fix is to have `Storage` reconstitute the correct value when reading from `transfers_db` if it encounters a missing value or an empty collection, and store the corrected value before returning it.  The `Storage::write_execution_results` method has also been corrected to not overwrite good values with empty collections.

Closes #4255.
Closes #4268.

title: Data extensibility for `Block` and `BlockBody`
body:
Merge data extensibility PoC (`Block` and `BlockBody`) into `feat-2.0`.

Fixes: #4240

title: 4134 finality signatures rewards
body:
Fix #4134 
New implementation of the rewards which not only rewards the blocks production, but also the signatures production and collection.

title: Fix after private-chain merge
body:
After doing the same merge three basically times (feat-1.6, #4109 and #4228) there's two issues fixed in this PR after #4109 :

- Due to conflicts, VFTA tests for locked amounts were incorrect (default should be 0 lockup, tests should exercise 90 days) - this was introduced in #3231, but conflicts in private chain changes made it revert to 90days.
- Payment errors penalty could've been paid to block proposer regardless of `fee_handling`/`refund_handling` option.

Once merged I'll apply this to both feat-1.6 (again) and feat-2.0

title: option to opt out of historical data sync
body: adds NoSync option, which allows a node to opt out of historical sync via config setting.

title: Fix failing test failures on `feat-1.6`
body: This PR hopefully gets the `feat-1.6` branch green again by fixing a few bugs and lints.

title: Make sure enough blocks are synced for rewarded signatures to be validatable
body:
This extends the `synced_to_ttl` function to also check if we have enough blocks for the rewarded finality signatures to be validatable.

Closes #4123

title: Allow to query the total supply from the contract runtime
Transaction gossiper
body:
This PR updates the `Gossiper<Deploy>` to `Gossiper<Transaction>` to support gossiping `TreansactionV1`s and `Deploy`s.

~It is built on top of #4236, so the only commit relevant to this change is [3a150b0](https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/commit/3a150b0a8a1d3e3235e8a22ca3211374e21fab58).~
Subsequently rebased on top of fresh `feat-2.0`.

Closes [#188](https://github.com/casper-network/roadmap/issues/188).

title: Update BlockValidator to validate cited finality signatures
body:
This PR extends the BlockValidator with functionality necessary for validating finality signatures cited in blocks for reward purposes.

A block is now only considered valid if all the cited finality signatures can be determined to exist on the network, in addition to all the existing criteria.

The nodes check for the signatures' existence by first consulting their local storage, and attempting to fetch any signatures that are missing locally - similar to how deploys are handled.

Closes #3913

title: Output `wasm-strip` version
body:
Output the `wasm-strip` version to console when building contracts. It's just a convenience for debugging purposes.

Example:
```
: ~/Casper/casper-node$ make build-contracts-rs 
Using 'wasm-strip' version 1.0.33 (git~1.0.33-25-gba73887a)
```

title: Change DeployAcceptor to TransactionAcceptor
body:
This PR updates the `DeployAcceptor` to `TransactionAcceptor` to allow acceptance of `TransactionV1`s and `Deploy`s.

The acceptance criteria for deploys should be unchanged by this PR, and the flow of V1 transactions through the acceptor is almost identical to that of deploys.  The test suite for the acceptor is also effectively unchanged in terms of exercising deploys, and only includes additional tests covering acceptance of V1 transactions.

Closes #4158.

title: Debug info about contract execution on `Trap::Unreachable`
body:
This PR adds some debug info output in case error is encountered during contract execution:

```
running 1 test
runtime stack overflow, current=501, max=500
test test::stack_overflow::runtime_stack_overflow_should_cause_unreachable_error ... ok
```

Closes https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/4002
Closes https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/4003

The scope has been slightly changed due to the discussion, currently, when `Trap::Unreachable` is caught we compare if the runtime stack has overflown and only then output the error message.

title: Merge `dev` into `feat-2.0`
body: Bring the recent changes from `dev` (mainly, the private chain support and fix for the slow historical sync) into `feat-2.0`.

title: Update state_get_account_info RPC handler
Verify that the sync response has been asked for
body:
If a node sends a sync response without being asked for, we disconnect from it.

Fix 4208

title: Data extensibility block conversion
body:
This is based on the work from @alsrdn here: https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/pull/4200

It adds few commits to address the original review comments.

Fixes: https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/4176
Fixes: https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/4178

title: Update ed25519-dalek to v2
body:
This resolves a new [RUSTSEC warning](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2022-0093).

Our own code should be updated in the future so that `pub fn sign` no longer takes a public key, but this is a breaking change and cannot be done in this PR.  In the meantime, the passed public key is ignored in all cases with the changes in this PR.

One unrelated test was affected by these changes (`inactive_validator_limited`), but this turned out to be an issue where random key generation was being done after the start of the test timer.  The test has been refactored to move the random generation to before the start of the timer.

Closes #4211.

title: Return early in case of a faulty sender
Attempt to fix block synchronizer request storm by tweaking the latching.
body:
Attempt to fix block synchronizer request storm by tweaking the latching.

Don't decrement the latch when responses for old requests that are no longer needed (are received in a state that expects other data).
For example if the synchonizer is the `HaveWeakFinality` state, it will try to fetch the block body from some peers. The latch will be incremented by `num_peers`. If a late finality signature response comes in this state it will decrement the latch. If multiple late responses come, the latch can become 0, and the synchronizer would try to fetch the block body again even if no response for the initial requests were received yet.

Added a test for this also. It's a bit ugly and copy-pasty but I think it showcases the issue.

Attempted fix for: https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/4202

title: Merge `dev` into `feat-1.6`.
body: Also contains a minor cleanup of CORS handling.

title: Feat 2.0 bid rework
body:
the main thrust of this change is, delegator bids are stored as top-level entries in global state under a composite key instead of embedded in a collection within their applicable validator's bid; this allows each bid to be interacted with atomically and avoids the deep copy issue of embedded collections within a stored value. there is a downside; getting total stake for a validator, reporting, and distributing rewards requires a lot more reads. this can be mitigated by adding a lazy last-era in-mem cache, which I propose we do in a separate optimization PR.

secondarily, empty (0 balance) bids and slashed bids are now pruned from the global state pathing (will not be included under the newly calculated root hash); this reduces width of a slice of global state at the tip of the chain. 

thirdly, the unbond experience is simplified. an attempt to unbond an amount greater than stake previously resulted in an error. the logic has been changed to simply unbond all of the stake when the attempted amount is higher rather than error. adjacent to this, previously an attempt to fully unbond was complicated by the fact that we re-stake rewards. there is an edge case of a fully unbonded bid gaining stake again due to the end of era reward for their last, leading to "dust" in their bonding purse. the logic now instead applies the delayed reward payout to the appropriate unbonding purse avoiding this issue.

title: node/max_ttl: remove error for timestamp chronology
body:
It is possible that if a node just caught up, its highest orphaned block is within the current active era.
Right now the node errors because the `latest_switch_block_timestamp` is lower than the `highest_orphaned_block_timestamp` but this is not necessary.

Fixes: https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/4160

title: Update k256 dependency
body:
This updates the `k256` dependency.

Closes #4107.

title: no ticket - Fix node changelog
body: This PR fixes the `casper-node` changelog, which was broken when merging `release-1.5.2` back to `dev`.

title: Rename Delete to Prune
body:
Closes #4175 

Renames `Transform::Delete` to `Transform::Purge` and also changes APIs incl. rustdocs to align to the same language (Delete keys -> Purge keys etc.)

title: GH-2064: Factory pattern MVP
body:
Closes #4179 

This PR implements MVP of a host-side factory pattern. 

- New `EntryPointType::Install` which marks the entry point as an installer aka the factory method.
- New `EntryPointType::Normal` variant that defines default entry point type that in 2.0 will act as a 1.x -
- Both new variants act as a 1.x `EntryPointType::Contract`
- New `EntryPointAccess::Abstract` variant that marks the entry point export as exists in the wasm bytecode but is not callable. It can be referenced from a contract that is stored as `EntryPointType::Install`.
- It is possible for `EntryPointType::Install` to define the new `EntryPointType::Install` as in the factory of factories.

An example smart contract that utilizes this pattern can be found here: https://github.com/mpapierski/casper-node/blob/gh-2064-factory-pattern/smart_contracts/contracts/test/counter-factory/src/main.rs

title: Add storage tests for data extensibility
body:
Starting with node 2.0, the `Block` struct is versioned.
Since this change impacts the storage APIs, add a test to check if we can still access the old unversioned blocks from storage.
Also check that both versioned and unversioned blocks can co-exist in storage and that block operations have correct side effects.

Implements: https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/4099

title: Introduce AddressableEntity
body:
CHANGELOG:

- Introduce the `AddressableEntity` type which unifies the `Account` and `Contract` structure and behavior
- Renamed `ContractPackage` to `Package` and created the `package.rs` mod which contains the relevant data types and behavior
- Added the `PackageKind` enum which identifies the type of `Package` (formerly the ContractPackage)
- Extended the `ContractPackage` struct to include a `PackageKind` enum which reflects the kind of `Package`
- Added migration capability to move legacy `Accounts`, `Contracts` and `ContractPackages` 
- Amended both `Runtime` and `RuntimeContext` structs to work with the unified `AddressableEntity` type

title: Transaction enum
body:
This PR adds the new `Transaction` enum to `casper-types`, with the recently-introduced `Transaction` struct being renamed to `TransactionV1`.

Closes #4157.

title: Updating branding for Casper Node
body:
This PR includes all changes made by the [other branding PR](https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/pull/3837) that appears abandoned.

Further, I've updated based on [Rafal's PR](https://github.com/0xE69/casper-node/pull/1) and Medha's review of the prior PR.

Related documentation tickets:
[Update branding and company name for node 1.6 #989](https://github.com/casper-network/docs/issues/989)

title: test scenarios for sync to genesis after restart when historical sync is working on blocks from era 0 created pre-1.5
body:
Before 1.5.0 there wasn't an immediate switch block committed at genesis.
Because historical sync relies on sync leaps to get the validators for a particular era, we encounter a special case when syncing the blocks of era 0 if they were created before 1.5.0 because sync leap will not be able to include a switch block that has the validators for era 0.
Since the auction delay is at least 1, we can generally rely on the fact that the validator set for era 1 and era 0 are the same.

Test if a node that has synced back to some block in era 0 can continue syncing to genesis after it was restarted (and lost its validator matrix).

Addresses: https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/4077

title: Data extensibility review comments
body:
This PR addresses some of the initial comments to the data extensibility PoC - this mainly applies to the disabled migration of data.

It does not include the recent comment from @Fraser999 and @EdHastingsCasperLabs to make what is currently called a `VersionedBlock` the main new type.

Also, it does not include comments from @alsrdn posted here: https://github.com/rafal-ch/casper-node/pull/18

title: Downgrade a log message
body: Closes #4141

title: Use execution journal instead of execution effects
body:
This PR changes the node to use `ExecutionJournal` in place of `ExecutionEffects`.

`ExecutionJournal` has been moved to `casper-types` accordingly, and while the old `ExecutionEffects` type in `casper-types` has been retained for syncing and reporting of historical data, the equivalent type in EE has been removed.

The `ExecutionJournal` also dropped the `Operations` field as this was unused and not populated, leaving the journal as simply a `Vec<Transform>`.

This work introduced a need for a new enum `ExecutionResult` holding old and new forms of execution results.  The `casper_execution_engine::engine_state::ExecutionResult` was updated to hold an `ExecutionJournal`, and we only need to support one flavour of this type, so it's not versioned.  However, the `casper_types::execution::ExecutionResult` became `casper_types::execution::ExecutionResultV1` and was otherwise structurally unchanged, as this is the type held in Storage and which is sent to other nodes/clients on demand.  The new `casper_types::execution::ExecutionResultV2` is equivalent to the updated `casper_execution_engine::engine_state::ExecutionResult` (with the difference continuing to be that the error type of the `casper_types` one is a `String` as `casper-types` has no access to EE error types).

Since Storage had to be updated to hold the new `ExecutionResult`s, I also took the opportunity to fix the long-standing issue of multiple execution results being attributed to a single deploy.  There is now a 1-1 mapping of deploy to execution result.

This PR is blocked by [client PR #85](https://github.com/casper-ecosystem/casper-client-rs/pull/85), since CI will likely fail until the client is updated.

Closes #2124.
Closes [#160](https://github.com/casper-network/roadmap/issues/160).

title: Use test_block_builder only for tests
body: Replace all the calls to `Block::random_XXX` with a use of `TestBlockBuilder`.

title: Introduce new `Transaction` type
body:
This PR introduces the `Transaction` type a.k.a "Version 2 Deploy".  It is expected that further changes and additions will be needed to many of the new types as they are integrated into the EE and node codebases.

Much of the code is copied from `Deploy`, but there are some significant differences:
* session code has been renamed `body: TransactionKind` which is a much more fine grained breakdown of the various execution modes compared to deploy's `ExecutableDeployItem`
* there is no payment code: standard payment will be assumed unless the Transaction includes custom payment logic in provided body Wasm
* ~the `TransactionHash` is a hash over "signing hash + approvals", where the "signing hash" is a hash over the header and the body.  The signing hash is not recorded anywhere; it is calculated only when required (once for verification, and once per new approval added).  This approach, where the `TransactionHash` includes the approvals, means that there should be no need to record hashes of approvals in global state.~ This change was reverted on instructions of @EdHastingsCasperLabs 
* ~the body hash has been removed from the header, since it served no useful purpose.  Transactions (and deploys) are never provided to clients or other nodes as just headers, they are always provided as full transactions/deploys, hence there is no benefit to recording the body hash in the header~ This change was reverted on instructions of @EdHastingsCasperLabs 
* the `dependencies` field has been removed from the header as it is also unused
* the `gas_price` has been repurposed into a `PricingMode` where `PricingMode::GasPriceMultiplier` represents the current `gas_price` behaviour

Note that the "interesting" changes are contained within the first commit.  The second commit touches a lot of files, but is simply a cleanup of the `runtime_args!` macro.

Closes [#181](https://github.com/casper-network/roadmap/issues/181).
Closes [#157](https://github.com/casper-network/roadmap/issues/157).

title: #4077 historical sync stall after restart in era 0 on pre-1.5 chain
body:
see: 
- https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/4077

this is an alternative attempt at it

title: Juliet crate
body:
This is the first iteration of the `juliet` crate, as described in the [Juliet RFC](https://github.com/marc-casperlabs/juliet-rfc/blob/master/juliet.md).

* Features: Complete in terms of API and implementation for everything that is the minimum for the 1.6 release. One feature is still missing (per-request timeout), to be finished as soon as time permits.
* Examples: One working example, `fizzbuzz`, showing that the core functionality works.
* Bugs: A lot still lurking in edge cases, as the test coverage is bad still.
* Tests: Easy unit tests are complete, but cover none of the actual behavior, just data types at the moment.
* Documentation: Almost complete, should cover everything including usage.

I will amend this PR with additional tests over the next few days, and potential bugfixes arising from them.

I recommend reading the crate documentation (e.g. using `cargo doc --open` locally) to get a good overview first, then refer to the linked RFC.

title: Version bumps
body: Version bumps related to node 1.5.2.

title: Add test for network recovery after at least 1/3 validators go down
body:
If more than 1/3 of the validator weight leaves the network, the network will stop producing blocks. When validators join back again such that more than 2/3 of weight is reached, the network should start producing blocks again.
Add a test that checks this scenario.

title: Add test for network recovery after at least 1/3 validators go down
body:
If more than 1/3 of the validator weight leaves the network, the network will stop producing blocks. When validators join back again such that more than 2/3 of weight is reached, the network should start producing blocks again.
Add a test that checks this scenario.

Closes #4118 and #4117

title: Update comment describing leap attempt because of stale gossip
body: This PR updates a comment to reflect the recent changes to `SyncInstruction` introduced [here](https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/pull/4110).

title: Fix network stall recovery
body:
Fixes an issue where it would be harder to recover if enough validators have left the network and the network is unable to progress. Once enough validators come back up, the network should resume producing blocks.
Because the validating nodes that remained up switched to CatchUp after a while, it was required that the new set of validators that come up to have enough stake to produce blocks.

With this fix, validators can come back up one by one, and the network will start producing blocks after sufficient weight is up.

Fixes: https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/4091

title: GH-3944: Merge feat private chain to dev
body:
Closes #3944 

This massive PR merges `feat-private-chain` branch into main code.

title: Add cors origin to REST, RPC, ESS and speculative execution servers
body:
This PR adds the ability of configuring CORS origin for REST, RPC, ESS and speculative execution servers.

It also bumps openssl to 0.10.55 to dodge the vulnerability: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2023-0044

Closes #4085.

title: Add casper-storage to casper-updater
body:
This PR updates the `casper-updater` tool to include `casper-storage`.

Closes #4035.

title: Merge `dev` to `feat-2.0`
body:
This PR brings `feat-2.0` up to date with `dev`.

There were a few conflicts, but none looked controversial to me.

Closes #3892.

title: Fix failing gh_3710 test.
body:
Closes #4096 

The issue was that `NonDeserializingStore` did not forward all the methods from base `Store` trait, and in result, ScratchTrie was misbehaving due to that.

title: Merge dev branch into feat-1.6
body: Merge dev branch into feat 1.6

title: Fix failures on global-state-update-gen
body: Related to #4066

title: Clean up EE types
body:
This PR cleans up some of the EE types, including those which were split to the new `casper-storage` crate.

For the most part, types were removed or their scope reduced, allowing the flattening of a couple of modules.

In EE:
* `Config` removed as unused
* `shared::logging` removed as unused (engine test support crate now uses `env-logger`)
* `shared::test_utils` removed as unused
* `shared::utils` removed (only OS page size functionality retained, but moved to `casper-types`)
* `shared::wasm_prep` moved to `runtime` and its functions' scopes reduced
* `shared::execution_journal` moved to `engine_state`
* `shared` removed
* `core` removed and its modules raised a level

In EE tests:
* `logging` removed as unused
* `profiling` folder containing source for three binaries removed along with a single smart contract associated with them.  These tools are no longer useful and don't currently run successfully.

In storage:
* `global_state::shared::make_array_newtype!` moved to the single test where it is used
* `global_state::shared::correlation_id` removed as previously agreed as unnecessary
* `global_state::storage` removed and its modules raised a level

A future PR will address moving `ExecutionJournal` and its nested types into `casper-types`.  This will allow the removal of `storage::global_state::shared` entirely.

Closes [#153](https://github.com/casper-network/roadmap/issues/153)
Closes #2760.
Closes #4064.

title: node/rpc-server/query_global_state: make state_identifier optional
body:
Make the `state_identifier` parameter of the `query_global_state` JSON-RPC method optional. If no `state_identifier` is specified, the highest complete block is used as an identifier.

Fixes: https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/4054

title: Bump openssl to `0.10.55`
body: This PR bumps openssl to `0.10.55` to dodge the vulnerability: https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2023-0044

title: ee/trie_store: refactor LazyTrieLeaf into LazilyDeserializedTrie
body:
This provides stronger type checking and allows us to remove useless paths in the code that are unreachable.

Fixes: https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/3994

title: Improve WASM errors for unknown/unsupported opcodes
body:
Fixes https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/3762

This PR adds custom error messages for unsupported WASM opcodes.

title: Fix serialization issues
body:
This PR fixes two issues caused by the recent move of deploy types to casper-types.

As part of that PR, two custom serializers in the `ExecutableDeployItem` enum were removed which shouldn't have been, meaning that parsing such an item which was stored e.g. by a 1.4.x node would fail.

A further issue was that binary serialization of `casper-node::types::DeployHash` delegated to `Digest`, which delegated to `Vec<u8>` for legacy reasons.  When bincode-encoding such a `DeployHash` it has a length prepended to the serialized data.  This is still how the moved `DeployHash` is handled.  However, prior to the move, there was a `casper_types::DeployHash` which delegated to `[u8; 32]` for binary serialization.  Bincode does not prepend a length for a fixed-length array like this.  As such, to retain the ability to parse historical stored data which held an old `casper_types::DeployHash`, we need to provide helpers to use array-style encoding rather than Vec.

Closes #4074.

title: consensus: don't error when deactivating era more than once
body:
Don't return a fatal error when trying to deactivate an era that was already deactivated.
In the case where a node unbonds and drops from the validator list, it will switch to `KeepUp` in order to follow the chain. Switching to `KeepUp` will try to deactivate the current era which would have been already deactivated when the last block of the era was added. Print out a debug message to track when this happens.

Fixes: https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/issues/4070

title: Change the reward scheme to a blocks window instead of a delay
body: Fixes #4065

title: Exclude proptest-regressions from packaged files
body:
This PR causes the `proptest-regressions` folder to be excluded from packaged files.

Closes #4061.

title: Make git hash an optional part of the node build version string
body:
This PR updates the node's build script to not require building from inside a git repo.

In the case of building outside a git repo, no git short hash is appended to the build version string, and a warning is emitted during the build and to the log just after running the node.

Closes #4060.

title: Move block types from casper-node to casper-types
body:
This PR moves most of the block types from `casper-node` to `casper-types`.

Of note are the following items:
* `BlockHeaderWithMetadata` was renamed to `SignedBlockHeader` as part of moving it to `casper-types`
* `BlockHeaderWithMetadataValidationError` was renamed to `SignedBlockHeaderValidationError` as part of moving it to `casper-types`
* `BlockWithMetadata` was renamed to `SignedBlock`, but was left in `casper-node` as it's an internal implementation detail to the node
* removed variants `UnexpectedDeployHash`, `MissingDeploy` and `ExtraDeploys` from `BlockValidationError` as they were unused
* in block's `json_compatibility` module, renamed `ValidatorWeight` to `JsonValidatorWeight`, and `Reward` to `JsonReward`, which affects the JSON-RPC schema
* `Block` was provided with getters for all fields in its header and body for consistency
* removed several files which were unused (presumably missed in a previous merge)
* changed a few files in `casper-types` to unify multiple impls (generally a second impl was feature-gated) in order to be consistent in the style.  This affects the generated rustdocs, as multiple impls are reflected in the docs

Closes #2137.

title: Purge block synchronizer every time we transition out of `CatchUp`
body:
The chain of events that lead to the error is:
1. Node restart for the emergency upgrade, chain is rewind to block 22 (switch block of Era 2)
2. Immediate switch block 23 is created, storage marks it complete
3. Node switches to CatchUp - and the sync identifier is SyncedBlockIdentifier(block 22)
4. MetaBlock marks the block 23 complete

Thanks to the added purge (in this case, the purge when switching from `CatchUp` to `Upgrading` is important), it is expected that `catch_up_process()` realizes that sync progress is `Idle` and will set-up sync leap with `BlockIdentifier` or `LocalTip`, instead of `SyncedBlockIdentifier(block 22)` as above.

Closes #4043

title: Move `Deploy` and its associated types to `casper-types` crate
body:
This PR moves the `Deploy` type and its associated types to `casper-types` crate.

Primarily the types involved lived in `casper-node` previously, but `ExecutableDeployItem` was moved from `casper-execution-engine`.

Existing types (e.g. `Digest`) were updated to be no-std compatible as far as possible in order to support no-std for as much of the code being moved into `casper-types` as possible.

There was also a small change made in [the first commit](https://github.com/casper-network/casper-node/commit/a608f99d7fa8491607c7659785138aeba759c881) to allow docs to be built with the [`doc_auto_cfg` feature](https://doc.rust-lang.org/rustdoc/unstable-features.html#doc_auto_cfg-automatically-generate-doccfg) enabled.  This allows more comprehensive docs to be generated, including those created automatically on docs.rs.  To view an example, run
```
RUSTDOCFLAGS="--cfg docsrs" cargo +nightly doc -p casper-types --all-features --no-deps --open
```

I also copied over the `DeployBuilder` from casper-client in order to allow the client to make better use of this changeset.

Closes #2138.

title: Log the `leap_instruction`
body:
Log the actual `leap_instruction` in order to help debugging our dance with various "instruction" functions.

In this particular case, the following call to `leap_instruction.should_leap()` flattens that actual leap instruction to `bool`.

title: Dropping max_ttl to 18 hours to match casper-protocol-release.
body: Matching change missed until casper-protocol-release for 1.5.1.

title: Dropping max_ttl to 18 hours to match casper-protocol-release.
body: Matching change missed until casper-protocol-release for 1.5.1.
